alert.note: Alert for Itasca (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 16 at 1:03PM CDT until further notice by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Minnesota... Prairie River near Taconite affecting Itasca County. Mississippi River at Fort Ripley affecting Morrison and Crow Wing Counties. Snake River near Pine City affecting Pine County. Mississippi River At Aitkin affecting Aitkin and Crow Wing Counties. .Rain on top of the existing snowpack will increase the rate of snowmelt. The resultant runoff will cause water levels in area rivers to increase and flooding is expected. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...Prairie River near Taconite. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Water level nears cabin on Lower Lawrence lake. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:45 PM CDT Sunday the stage was 10.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 12:45 PM CDT Sunday was 10.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 11.0 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage Wednesday evening. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 11.0 feet on 04/16/2001. - Flood safety information can be found at www.weather.gov/safety/flood. && Fld Observed Forecasts (1 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed Prairie River Taconite 10.0 10.7 Sun 12 pm CD 10.9 10.5 10.1 &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/duluth. The next statement will be issued Monday evening by 630 PM CDT.
